DOC.brief_summary: Hyperpronation is af frequent cause of excessive load in foot and crus. Pain and limited functional ability cause problems with work-related activities, sport activities and leisure activities. There are only few studies of the frequency of pain related to hyperpronation in foot and the effect of exercises. Medics and physiotherapists need sufficient evidence-based knowledge to treat these patients correctly. Therefore, the investigators want to study the effect of exercises and inner soles for treatment of patients with chronic pain and hyperpronation of foot.
DOC.criteria: Hyperpronation of foot Consent of information Normal gait Lack of consent of information Unable to speak and read Danish
